page.title: 19Clive Hall Farm
page.content: Clive Farm has 225 acres of land with the farm buildings being over 200 years old. The present owners have lived at the farm for 40 years and now have 90 milking cows, 15 chickens, 10 beef cattle, and 30 heifers. 20 acres are used for wheat, 65 for barley, and 60 are rough grazing. Crops are sold at Shrewsbury market. The farm workers rise at 7am and finish work usually at 6pm depending on the season. The farm owns tractors, a combine harvester, silage trucks, harrows, balers and cultivators. The farm does not exhibit any of its animals at shows as the farmer considers they are not good enough. 2 other people are employed on the farm as well at the owner. The farmer enjoys most harvesting the crops and most dislikes cleaning out the septic tank.
